D1.label: US Expansion Accelerates
D1.description: Pro Medicus executes on growth strategy; earnings accelerate
D1.plain_english: Pro Medicus continues winning major US health system contracts, growing from ~10% to 25%+ market share over the next 5 years. Cloud-native architecture creates structural cost advantage competitors cannot replicate.
D1.what_to_watch: Next earnings result and forward guidance.
D1.upside: Material re-rating if execution surprises to the upside.
D1.risk_plain: If growth disappoints, this narrative weakens.

D2.label: Valuation Mean-Reversion
D2.description: Pro Medicus delivers steady-state results; valuation holds
D2.plain_english: The 163x P/E contracts to a more conventional 50-80x as growth decelerates or market sentiment shifts. Even extraordinary business quality has a price.
D2.risk_plain: If the base case is already priced in, limited upside from here.

D3.label: Competitive Disruption
D3.description: Pro Medicus faces headwinds; earnings or multiples compress
D3.plain_english: A competitor (existing or new entrant) develops a platform that matches Visage 7's cloud-native architecture, eroding Pro Medicus's structural advantage.
D3.what_to_watch: Cost pressures, competitive threats, or macro headwinds.
D3.risk_plain: Material downside if multiple risks crystallise simultaneously.

D4.label: AI Amplifies the Moat
D4.description: A structural shift changes the investment case for Pro Medicus
D4.plain_english: Pro Medicus becomes the platform on which AI radiology tools run, deepening stickiness and expanding per-study economics. Platform companies historically capture more value than point-solution vendors.
D4.what_to_watch: Industry disruption signals and regulatory changes.
D4.upside: See research report for upside scenario detail.
D4.risk_plain: If disruption materialises, prior assumptions become invalid.

big_picture: The most extraordinary business on the ASX: Visage 7 generates 77% EBITDA margins with 132 employees (A$1.6M rev/head). Zero debt, A$211M cash, A$520M in new FY25 contracts including Trinity Health (A$330M) and UCHealth (A$170M). Revenue grew 32%, NPAT up 39%. US market share only ~10%. Morningstar's A$36 fair value is analytically questionable for a platform business with this quality of economics.
